Feb 15 2009	Great location. Oh so many problems.	First my wife and I booked this room through Expedia for Valentines Day and it will be the last time we use Expedia for future vacation plans. We requested a king bed but apparently our reservation could not be guaranteed and upon arrival found that the only availability were two doubles.The hotel arrangement overall is poorly executed and the elevator situation is awful. The hotel could use another 4-5 elevators. We waited on average of 3 minutes for an elevator and at one point had a 10 minute wait before deciding to take the stairs. And to use the elevator (even going down to the lobby from your room) you had to swipe your key card before pressing the button. I'm all about hotel security, but this is just overkill.At night when the hotel restaurant is in full force there is an unpleasant fish odor throughout the hotel lobby and ground level areas.As for the rooms, they are small even for Chicago standards. The bathrooms offer little in the way of privacy. I will admit having glass walls in the showers provides opportunities for "fun" times, but the sliding door (that never stays closed) and exterior shower curtain don't provide the proper privacy for actually USING the bathroom.To whomever designed the rooms, exposed concrete ceilings and pillars are not attractive especially when there are water/rust stains. Overall I don't recommend this hotel unless you are on a business trip alone and don't plan on staying in your room for very much time. Jan 29 2009 	Good Potential but not there yet...	The hotel had very nice ammenities with modern styling but was suffering startup pains. I checked in on Sunday night to find the room temperature at 46F, the thermostat was set at 72F so I called down for assistance. An engineer came up quite fast and told me that the hotel has only been open 6 months and that they have been having so many problems with the heat pumps that they don't want to fix them anymore and want the manufacturer to replace them. While he worked on the furnace I turned on the TV - the picture was un-watchable there was so much static - the engineer called the IT guy who came up quite quickly and fixed it at about the same time the engineer got the heater working. Great, minor mishap, understandable for a new hotel.I woke up at 4:30am, the room was 55F. I put on a hat and kept sleeping then got up, got ready for my conference (a conference on heating and ventilation - the irony) and called down to the front desk to request a new room as this furnace was not going to get fixed; they sent up an engineer. The engineer told me it was a building problem but I insisted that I want a new room so I packed my bags, waited for the bellhop and then moved to a higher floor room directly above the one I was in; this room was 55F too! I left for my conference and told the front desk that the second room was cold too and the heat was not working. The response was that there was a problem with the building heating and that they were working on it - ok.I came back at 6:30pm and the room was still 55F. I called down and they sent an engineer (the same guy from before). This guy was helpfull, appologized and said "lets get you a different room, on the other side of the building". I packed my bags again and moved to the new room. This final room was great, the heat worked fine. I checked out the next day expecting an apology and possibly even a rebate for spending a night in a room with no heat during a bitter Chicago winter and then having to pack my bags two times to move rooms (I like my shirts crisp and re-ironed them each time I folded them up into my bag). I didn't even get asked how my stay was.Will I stay here again? Maybe in summer if the rate is low or if they can give me a money back guarantee that the HVAC will operate otherwise no.

Dec 31 2008 	Hotel exceeded expectations spa not so much!	From the beginning of our stay, the hotel staff was very accomodating. Dec 31 2008 	We can't wait to go back	We had the absolute pleasure of staying at the Dana Hotel on our way through Chicago. Dec 9 2008 	Not quite 100% yet	A new hotel, billing itself as "cool, small boutique" which about sums it up. Dec 7 2008 	Modern Luxury at the Dana	My boyfriend and I stayed here on a Friday night. We requested an upper level room and were promptly placed in a corner room on the 20th floor. Our room had two walls of windows and a spectacular view. The view alone justifies the price. In addition to the view, however, the Dana room contained the single most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in--imported linens, king-sized bed, fluffy down comforter, a mountain of pillows. It is strange entering the hotel through the bottom floor restaurant, but a friendly host quickly directed us upstairs to the lobby. We also checked out Vertigo, the lounge on the top floor, but it was packed at 11:30 on a Friday night, so we opted for the quiet of our room instead. The shower is big enough for several adults and the water pressure is great. The set-up is a little strange--with just one night there, we weren't able to master showering without soaking the rest of the bathroom, as the shower does not have a door that closes, but it's still quite nice. There is only a curtain over a glass wall blocking the view of the shower/bathroom from the rest of the room, but it wasn't an issue for us. The continental breakfast Saturday morning was impressive, as far as continental breakfasts go. There was a large room service menu available at all times of day, but we did not try it. We took breakfast back to our room and made mimosas. Overall, the staff was friendly and competent, the ambiance was great, the furnishings were modern but comfortable, and all of that, in such a prime location, close to so much activity downtown, simply can't be beat.

Dec 1 2008 	Nice Hotel	My husband and I stayed at the Dana for a Friday and Saturday night in November. We traveled to Chicago for a long weekend get away, and were looking forward to relaxation. We'll start by saying that we enjoyed many aspects of the hotel, though had a few minor issues. We checked in on Friday and requested an upper level room, hoping for nice views. We were placed on the 24th (of 26) floor, in a nicely appointed room. The bed was quite comfortable, had a plush down comforter and down pillows. The i-pod speaker system was very convenient, and definitely was a nice addition. The shower was big enough for two adults, and the bathroom as a whole was very nice. Friday night, both my husband and I were quite tired after a long work week, and wanted to rest and go to bed early. At approximately 9 pm, we began hearing rather loud, thumping bass music. We waited several hours, attempting to determine where the sound was coming from?! At 11 pm, the bass continued to be quite loud and slightly disrupting when attempting to fall asleep. My husband called down to the front desk reporting the noise and was advised they would further investigate. At 11:30, the same music continued, and we called down to the front desk again. Finally, at 12:15, my husband went in search of where the sound was coming from. At that point, he realized there was a night club on the 26th (top) floor, with music that could be heard several floors down. He requested a room transfer, and we moved (at 1 am) to the 12th floor, where it was thankfully quiet. The hotel did give us a complimentary bottle of wine, which was a nice compensation. Saturday night, many night club patrons were also in the hotel elevators, and the music was again noted to be loud on the upper floors. So, a suggestion may be to avoid the upper level rooms if you are a light sleeper, or want a quiet room atmosphere. Overall, we enjoyed the room, but personally felt like old-fogeys (we are in our early 30's?), in the trendy, chic atmosphere of the hotel.

Nov 16 2008 	Lovely Boutique hotel	The hotel is quietly tucked on a corner in a great location. Nov 9 2008 	A great experience	I had a wonderful stay at the Dana Hotel. I can't speak to the size of the standard rooms because I received a complimentary upgrade to a suite upon our arrival. Nov 3 2008 	What a pleasant surprise...	I was looking for a place to do interviews in downtown Chicago and stumbled upon the Dana on the internet. Oct 30 2008	Good concept that does not work	Fist let me say what is great about the Dana Hotel-its location. It is a block from Starbucks, Trader Joes, Dues Pizza, movie theaters, and just about everything else. The neighborhood is called Northbridge and it is jumping! One great place a block away is a Champaign Bar which is the epitome of chic!! I wanted to go there because I like Champaign but it was always packed. One night I spotted an empty seat at the bar and landed it. They have a large selection of Champaign by the glass ranging in price from $18-$22. I had two glasses and it was great. I highly recommend this place. There is also an upscale frozen yogurt place directly across the street from the hotel selling avant-garde frozen yogurt where a large one will cost you $10. This place is open until 2am on weekends. And immediately across the street from the Dana is an upscale restaurant which serves dinner until 4am. I tested this out and it is true- I went in at 3 am and got a great fillet minion dinner and the place was packed. People were still coming in at 3:30 am!Now the downside of the hotel. It is a new hotel and they advertise that the rooms have one wall which is literally floor to ceiling glass and great views of the city. Well my room (which was rather small) had the wall of glass directly across a narrow street from a building of condominiums. So the view I had from my glass wall was directly into the living quarters of about 20 people, and vice versa. It was so bad that at night I would walk around my room with the lights off in my nighties and when someone across the street turned on their kitchen light it would light up my room and I would have to grab a sheet and cover myself up. For any privacy you practically have to put the shades down when you are in the room and that makes it just another very small dark room. Another problem I found with the Dana is that they have a bar on the roof and the access to it is through the same elevators that go to the rooms. I came home one evening and the hotel had a hawker on the street in front of hotel promoting the bar and drawing crowds from the street the hotel. It became quite crowded on the first floor and I had to wait in line to get to the elevator and then went up it with people pulled off the street. It was not a pleasant experience. When looking for a hotel in Chicago the Dana was the lowest priced 4 star hotel at $172 while competing hotels were in the $300 range. I would say that for the price the Dana is a deal and worth choosing. At a higher price I would think twice about staying there.

Oct 28 2008 	I will return to the DANA HOTEL and SPA!	My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Dana Hotel. The door men, bell hops, and even the hotess for the restaurant downstairs would hold conversations with us opon entering and exiting the building. We walked there and back, I think it's only 4 blocks? It's also located in a great area near alot of restaurants and places to go out. We stayed in a "Serene King" and it was amazing. We had a corner room with floor to ceiling windows and the view was great. We never felt like we were staying in a hotel, but rather a really nice upscale condo. Everything in the room was modern including the shower which you can view from the bed or pull the curtain for privacy. My favorite part was the shower head that was literally above my head... very relaxing! The bed was very comfortable with an overstuffed comforter. The room was very romantic without trying too hard.  Both nights we stayed at the Dana we went to their "Vertigo Lounge" either before we went out or to close out the evening. The music was very chill and relaxing, but put you in the dancing mood and the seating was pretty comfortable. More like you were sitting in a nice living room with a great view, and very dim lights. We didn't go out onto the "outside patio" because it was just a little too cold outside. We walked down and checked out the Spa... it looks really nice. We didn't have anything done, but we promised that when we return we definitely will! They also had a nice workout area with equipment I've never seen lol! We also didn't get a chance to eat at their restaurant, but both nights they seemed pretty busy. All and all, my boyfriend and I LOVED the Dana Hotel and enjoyed our stay. We recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chicago. We plan on returning early 2009. I hope this helps your future traveling to Chicago! :)

Sep 24 2008 	2 Thumbs up from a seasoned (and cynical) traveller!	I stayed at the Dana on business, Sept. 17 through 19. Sure, it is a new hotel, and they are still working on the kinks...I had my "new" bedside tables delivered after my first night. But, that all is trivial. The bed was so comfortable, the room was fantastic. I also have to add, that I got a courtesy upgrade to a nirvana suite - what a pleasant surprise and a beautiful room. But for me, the staff and comfort made my stay. And the continental breakfast in the lounge was a pleasant (and tasty) surprise. Very european - not what you usually find in the US.I'm surprised by the reviews that list the staff as rude or unfriendly. That certainly was not my experience at all....all were very pleasant, kind and attentive to me - from check-in, room service, concierge, housekeeping and doorman. I interacted with them all and they all made me feel welcome and at home.The Dana is now the only place I'll stay in Chicago. And that's a first for me. Usually, I'll take the cheapest good enough thing I can find on priceline. Perhaps it was poor luck that we stayed next to a couple of yahoos who loved to play their loud bass music at 1am and go in and out of their rooms 18 times an hour, but something about the hotel doesnt seem to cushion the noise well. You can hear a door closing from down the hall (those doors are [--] loud!).I dont want to end on a bad note because I really did have a good time. They leave you cookies each night. The bathrobes and slippers are very nice. The coffee (Green Mountain) is free and good quality and is ready in about 3 minutes. It's a good place to stay, but I wouldnt spend $300 a night to stay there. (Here is a tip: I found a good rate on travelocity but then called the hotel and they gave me their best rate guarantee discount of 10%, so we ended up staying for $170 a night which was well worth it).

Jul 31 2008 	A Terrific Experience	Our stay at the Dana was wonderful. We spent the night to celebrate our anniversary this summer. Jul 25 2008 	5 stars for the Dana Hotel 	I spent last weekend at the Dana Hotel & Spa with my mom and sisters for a glorious birthday weekend. The rooms were immaculate and the staff was impeccable. Jul 21 2008 	New Chicago Hot Spot	We live in Chicago, but wanted to stay downtown for our 5-year anniversary. My wife found this hotel while searching online. It is very modern and has some neat amenities in the room. It is a great location for the out of towners who are looking to shop and do the touristy activities.From the moment we arrived through the time we left, we were treated like king and queen. We were give a corner room, number 812 that had a balcony facing north and ceiling to floor windows. The rooms have a modern feel and from what I understand our built form recycled material, including wood floors etc... There is a shower that get this, actually has great water pressure and a window that allows you to watch TV :). The bed was super comfy and the blackout shades allowed us to sleep in!We did not have a chance to visit the bar or restaurant as we had other plans, but it was hopping when we came back at midnight. My guess is that the locals are going to start making this a hot spot. We also did not go to the spa, although it looked pretty nice when I toured it (a lot of tile and things made form recycled materials).For $250, the value was supreme and the service was impeccable. I would highly recommend this to anyone coming to town, even for business!

Jul 19 2008 	Great rooms - but paint fumes a dealbreaker	3.0 rating reflects very mixed experience - some aspects qualify for a 5.0, but paint fumes in fact made it a 1.0.Pros: Great location; extremely helpful and friendly staff; free wi-fi; rooms beautifully appointed with exciting design details and amazing picture window views (some with balconies); good coffee maker in room with complimentary coffee and tea; great bath products.Cons: Some of the exciting design details tried too hard and didn't work that well in practice; poor sound-proofing both to hallway and street. Biggest problem at the time of our visit was that the hotel is so spanking new (about 1 month old) that the chemical fumes from paint, carpets, furniture etc. were overwhelming and caused us to check out prematurely after just the first night. Oct 26 2009 	What a let down!	My family and I stayed at the Embassy Suites for a long weekend. My daughter woke up with a sore back the next morning. Overall, a very disappointing stay. We will definately be looking to stay somewhere else the next time we visit the windy city!!

Oct 24 2009 	Clean comfortable and easy access to places.	I love the suite because you get the additional room. Hubby say meeting rooms adaquate. He told me everything I wanted to know. Go on the Chicago Trolley for a tour one day or three. I went three. It was awsome. You hop on and off as you wish. You just have to get back on by 5pm or you can take a taxi which can get really expensive. Did not take the el which is the train or any buses. Paid for a taxi so we could get there. Don't really drink but they had free drinks from 530-730pm. they made me a sex in the beach and it tasted like koolaid. Sep 26 2009 	great choice for a central place to stay	We spent a week at this hotel while on a sightseeing trip to Chicago from the west coast. It was the perfect spot. Sep 24 2009 	Decent - but not WOWSA!	I stayed here earlier this week for business. We got a great group rate - otherwise I would not have paid close to $300 for a hotel per night. That's just me.ALL of my telephone conversations with the hotel were FANTASTIC. I called a couple of days prior to make some special requests, including an early check in. When I got to the front desk - early - they indicated the room they had reserved for me was not yet available, but he found one that was and offered to have my special requests (extra pillows) brought up to the room. I hadn't been in the room 5 minutes before they arrived. FANTASTIC.I left shortly therafter, stopping at the concierge to ask about going to the aquarium. Yeah, he was a little too busy to deal with me and did not give me any advice other than to say take the bus. I opted for a cab - and the cabbie REALLY didn't want to deal with traffic from the football game - and told me that it would probably take 45 mintues to get to the aquarium that day. Would have been nice if the concierge had filled me in on that tidbit. So I took a $6 cab ride to the Navy Pier (which I could have gotten a shuttle for free - about a block away from the hotel).When I got back to the hotel, I walked around a couple of blocks. A single woman on a Sunday late afternoon, I felt safe. The hotel is right in the thick of things, so there was plenty to catch my attention. I ate dinner and headed back to the hotel, exhausted from flying and the time difference.I grabbed a glass of wine at the reception. I'm not a huge drinker, so this was not a deal breaker for me. As others have said, it's nice, but the nibbles were ptretzels and maybe honeydew melon? Most all of it was gone when I got there (about 6:30 p.m.). Back to the room which was nice and clean. The couch in the sitting room wasn't all that great, so I opted to watch TV on the bed. That's when the flat screen would have been nicer in the bedroom (it was in the LR). The remotes were worn, so there were some buttons I couldn't see what they did. I could never get the sleep timer to work, but again, not a deal breaker for me. I never called the front desk to ask them to switch it or tell me how. I fell asleep early!The alarm woke me up the next morning, so I was relieved it worked. Went downstairs and had a HEAVENLY breakfast. Spinach, bacon and cheese omlette with a toasted bagel. I'm a bacon snob, and I've been on a diet (which I decided to blow for this trip) and had bacon strips. Oh, they were good. I truly could have eaten a pound of it, if I thought no one was looking! My only complaint is I woudl have liked bigger glasses for the soft drinks. Yeah, I drink a diet drink in the morning, not coffee.Off to my meeting. Came back and talked to a new concierge about getting a shuttle to the airport. This gentleman on Monday was MUCH nicer than the one on Sunday. He wasn't overly effusive, but he managed to get the job done and correctly! My shuttle was to arrive at 6:30 A.M. the next morning, so it was off to dinner with friends and some more walking around.At 6:25 a.m., the only hotel personnel that I saw was a housekeeper sweeping out front. She was friendly, but it would have been nice to see a bellman, or a front desk person. My shuttle arrived, about 6:40 a.m., so I was off.A whirlwind visit, but a hotel I would stay in again, just not for $300 a night. I liked my group rate, thank you very much!

Sep 21 2009 	Good but could be better	We stayed at this hotel for 5 days from 7 Sept. Things we loved about the room - spacious with separate bedroom, clean and beds were comfortable. Things we loved about the hotel facilities - free breakfast with lots of variety, pool and jacuzzi, manager's reception in the evenings.Things that could have been better - friendliness of front of house staff, availability of concierge and pool was quite green and doesn't appear to have been cleaned regularly. Overall it was excellent value for the rates we paid and location was great.

Sep 14 2009 	This hotel is awesome....stay here!	From the moment we walked in the door....no, from the moment we approached the parking entrance and a passing employee stopped to offer instruction for parking and good wishes for our stay, the service in this hotel was first rate.I admit it....I'm a bit of a hotel pig. This hotel did NOT leave me wanting. From the fabulous free breakfast featuring an omelet maker to needing to get a duplicate valet ticket because I lost mine, EACH and EVERY member of the staff went out of their way to make me feel welcome and to be helpful. The purpose of our trip was our daughter's Sweet 16 birthday. We took her and 3 of her friends for a shopping weekend and they all absolutely loved it.I tip well generally because I think it's the right thing to do, but I don't mind telling you to bring extra cash because you'll tip more than usual!After the service, the location of the hotel is great for walking to Water Tower Place/Hancock center and, if you really like to walk, to Navy Pier. Aug 19 2009 	nice location but is it really worth the money???	if you're loaded and looking to spend your cash on a hotel, this would be the place to go. don't get me wrong, the hotel is beautiful and located on State Street in downtown Chicago, but honestly, $300 a night is a bit too much for me. And parking within the hotel is an additional $44 per day. The lobby and atrium are gorgeous, as to be expected for this area but the rooms, well i guess it's location, location, location. Around the corner is the Hard Rock Cafe, Rainforest Cafe, Red Head Piano Bar and other various attractions. The Embassy offers a full breakfast which honestly wasn't the best i've ever had. As for the room, we had a living room with flat screen tv and work table, mini fridge and microwave, decent sized bathroom, make-up mirror with sink - separate from the bathroom, and king sized bed. The a/c didn't seem to work very well if at all, the toilet acted close to overflowing, outside window only opens a few inches with the opening blocked by the heavy curtains. Alarm clock in the room does have the option to plug in your ipod/mp3 player but the volume didn't seem to work either. This is a non-smoking hotel so you have to go out to the front in order to do so. There is a restaurant/bar located inside the Embassy also.

Aug 4 2009 	Outstanding location service and facilities...	This hotel is one well oiled machine. While we were there, the place seemed to be at 100% occupancy. There was a large family reunion, a large wedding in the ballroom and party afterwards in the atrium. All the while, in another area, cranking out cocktails effortlessly for the usual manager's reception. The staff was courteous yet unobtrusive and quick to respond to your needs. Our rollway popped a rivet which caused it not to close. No problem. A phone call and maintenance is there in five minutes. Rooms are kept in tip top shape. Excellent concierge service.The location can't be beat. One block to the Red Line CTA. Three blocks to Michigan Avenue and the bus lines. Surrounded by good restaurants, chains and indigenous ones alike. The breakfast buffet is icing on the cake, especially for a family. Excellent omelets and lots of other items to choose from.I am a usually pretty harsh judge, but can't think of a more suitable hotel in Chicago for a family vacation.

Aug 2 2009 	Good and not so good experiences	My kids and I stayed here for a weekend getaway. I called a few days before arriving, and requested early check in if possible. I was told that a room should be ready for us between 11am and noon. We arrived at 12:15pm on a Friday, waited about 10 minutes for a front desk person to be available to help me, and were told, "Unfortunately, your room won't be available until 3pm." Okay...I know eary check in isn't guaranteed, but that was disappointing. We left our luggage with in the bellman's closet, and went to get some lunch and do some window shopping. We got back to the hotel at 3:10pm to find a longggggg line of guests waiting to check in. We got in line, and it was finally our turn at 4:15pm. Not a great way to start our weekend, to say the least. Nellie at the front desk needs to learn to put a smile on her face and to speak to the hotel's customers. She was utterly silent while looking up my reservation, generating our keys, etc.By comparison, Hector the bellman is fabulous! Such a wonderful attitude, helpful and a wonderful ambassador for the hotel. Richard, one of the concierges, was great with his help in our obtaining advance tickets for the Shedd Aquarium, and we were able to walk right in instead of waiting in a very, very long line.The floorplan of the room is great for families. The bathroom, however, had issues. There was hair...dark hair (we're all light haired) on the bathroom floor and in the bathtub....YUCK!! I turned the shower massager band to get a different flow from the spout, and the band came off in my hand. We requested a maintenance person come address the shower, and no one ever came. Yes, it was a very busy weekend for the hotel, but that was disappointing as well.We come to Chicago once or twice a year; we usually stay in a burb because the hotels are a fraction of the cost of the hotels in downtown Chicago. We decided to stay downtown this time and see if the higher cost made the experience better for us. Sadly, it didn't; back to the burbs for us from now on.

Jul 16 2009 	Great Chicago stay	This Embassy Suites appeared to be better than other Embassy Suites hotels that we have stayed at. Upon arrival at about 10:30 AM, the room was ready. The fitness center was much larger and better than other Embassy Suites hotels that we have stayed at. The concierge (Phillip) was very helpful with all of our needs.The only downside to this hotel was the GIGANTIC breakfast line. In other Embassy Suites hotels, the line is much shorter. Jul 8 2009 	Great hotel staff service and location	I've stayed at this Embassy more than once and have never had a bad experience. The staff has always been friendly and helpful. Jul 6 2009 	Perfect Location for Tourists But Know about the Extra Charges	My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights for a trade show. The hotel met my expectations--location is great; everything was clean; breakfast was the typical Embassy buffet;the nightly manager's reception was better than most. The hotel was generally crowded with lots of families but not excessively so. Wedding receptions can be noisy here so ask for a room on the upper floors. The pool is small, but that wasn't a concern to me.  I would definitely stay again. I would suggest that you review is the list of charges when deciding where to stay. Parking was expensive at $44 per night, but that's true of all Chicago hotels (see below). The surprising extra charge was the $9.95 Internet charge per day--per computer, which adds up over a week when you have 2 computers for business. My husband and I both need to work from the computer so we each take a laptop. When he was gone with his computer during the day for business, I had to pay to connect with my laptop. The system recognizes the different computers and charges for each. Many chains provide free wi-fi and don't charge for multiple computers so I was surprised. However, this is probably a concern for only a small fraction of people. You can use the computers in the business center for free (including printing) but you can't work from there all day, obviously.The Italian restaurant at the hotel (Osteria on State) is excellent. We had late night pizza twice and had a fixed price multi-course dinner another night. Dinner began with small plates, then a salad, then pasta, then the meat and potatoes. Also in walking distance was the Chicago Chop House, Rainforest Cafe, the famous McDonalds, Volare's, Weber's and many more.You can walk to most of the desired shopping (Magnificent Mile and State Street) areas. The neighborhood seemed safe and was very active. For parking discounts, use one of the public lots within two blocks.I got a much better rate by using GTAhotels.com (no, I don't work for/with them) than I could get with the hotel or my Hilton Honors. ES wouldn't match their rate even though I asked.

Jul 5 2009 	Good location for family trip	This property is a good choice if you are traveling with children. We were able to walk to the subway, the bus, shopping, dining, sightseeing. The staff was very helpful (especially Roberto who helped us with our luggage) and the suites were well appointed, with plenty of room and privacy for parents and kids. The bathroom was a bit narrow, as is often the case in Embassy Suites, but the extra sink in the bedroom helps with the traffic flow when your whole family is trying to get ready at the same time! There is no view to speak of, and it sometimes got a bit noisy, but overall this did not bother me. One surprise is that the complementary manager's reception serves a full bar, not just beer and wine. The breakfast got ridiculously crowded, though, and the location of the breakfast buffet in relation to the elevators makes it worse. Another complaint is that the parking is very very expensive, but I am sure that is competitive with other properties in the area. Overall, not perfect, but a good deal.
Jul 4 2009 	Awesome!	This is a fantastic place to stay! They are very helpful and the breakfast is awesome! The concierge was very helpful. I would highly recommend a stay here!

Jun 29 2009 	Definite Recommend for Families with Children	My husband and I booked the Embassy Suites for a long vacation weekend with our 20 month old son. This was our first trip with our son, so we were very concerned about how he would sleep in a new environment. The hotel was very accommodating, especially with regard to our need for a crib. They originally gave us a Pak&Play, but send housekeeping up immediately with a 'real' crib when we called the front desk. The last night was a Saturday and there were older kids from dance teams yelling and playing in the Atrium as late as 10:45 pm, keeping our baby awake. My husband had to call the front desk twice to complain, but ultimately the manager on duty resolved the problem and gave us that night free. Despite the noise issue that night, we were very impressed with how the hotel handled customer service issues, and with the general 'can do' attitude of everyone from the front desk staff to valets to maids and doormen.The hotel is brimming with families with children, and the free breakfast buffet is a particular family mob scene. If I were in town without kids or on business, however, I would run screaming in the other direction. In other words, it's a great place to stay with kids, but if you don't have kids, there are way too many kids!Location is perfect. Oh, AND the workout room is great. Not big, but just right for the relative few guests that seem to use it and the cardio equipment is the best I've used in a long time, having visited lots of gyms. Biggest minuses: Chaotic lobby, always packed swimming pool, and crazy loud kids (other than mine, of course).

However, when I came back to my room that night after it had been cleaned, I found the old smokey one still attached to the wall and the new one just sitting there on the sink!??? We're not talking regualr handheld hair dryers. These are the dryers with a large base that is supposed to be attached to the wall.To top it off, I went to make coffee preparations for the morning and discovered housekeeping didn't bother to refill the coffee or creamer/sugar. It's close to midnight and instead of going to sleep like I wanted to a half hour ago, I'm sitting here waiting for housekeeping to refill the coffee service. I wouldn't suggest this hotel for business travelers. They need better oversight..

Apr 15 2009 	Enjoy your stay but with some caution	I stay at a lot of Hilton properties in Chicago-- good value for th $$ and most hotels are well reviewed. Hilton owns quite a few properties in Chicago and while I normally stay at either the Homewood Suites or Hilton Garden, this Embassy Suites had a better price and an extra bedroom. Check in was a breeze. Frontline staff very personal and helpful, even our valet parking assistant was great. Our room was ready and it appeared clean in the surface. All's well so far. We returned well into the evening after a great meal believe or not at the California Pizza Kitchen down the road (PF Changs also around the corner). We took stocked of our plans and decided to extend our stay by a day. Again, front staff handled our request with precision and a smile. Went to bed and slept well.Breakfast time!!! I am not at a 5star and don't expect it to be but, why can't the Embassy Suites do something different with their breakfast bar? Don't offer it if you cannot get it right. Worse food I have had in a long time! The place was packed with little ones carrying their dolls (so cute) so it was a bit noisy but that 's okay. They were fun to watch. The omlet was not good. The buffet had cold eggs and bacon and I refused to let my elderly mother eat their cold eggs for fear of bacteria. Coffee cups held maybe a half a cup. Cereal was stale. Thank goodness my mini muffin & fruit were edible.Let's go back to my room for a minute. While I said it was clean, I suggest to Hilton that it is time to change the furniture. The armchair and couch in 622 are badly worn. Isn't this just a cost of doing business, to recover or replace worn furniture? This is the bad. Now for the ugly.Day one I used the main restroom outside of the pool. Filthy! Toilets dirty. Floor had not been mopped in a couple of days or so it seemed. Just get me out and back to the room. Day two, certainly the staff has had time to catch up after a busy Easter weekend full of messy children. I watch the cleaning staff come out of the bathroom with hope. No such luck. Just as bad. Not sure anything had been done! This is the Embassy Suite for crying out loud, not Motel sick! I did register my comments as I am not afraid to speak out for the good and the bad. Come on managment. Don't worry so much about the front fountain and look at what the cleaning team is not up to. And then go eat breakfast in your kitchen. I'll bet you make some quick changes. Sure I will be back because as I said it's good value for $$$. I just wish someone way way up in Embassy Suites would take note and change the food. In my business we either do it right, don't do it, or change the way it's done so it is right.

Feb 23 2009 	OPRAH FANS - this is the place to stay!!!!	If you are, like me, a huge OPRAH fan, this is the hotel for you!!! We had excellent service from the hotel even before checking in!!! I reviewed the hotel on this site and saw so many wonderful comments, so my girlfriend and I booked a room here. I contacted the Concierge in advance of arrival about possibly getting tickets to Oprah since I was unable to get them in advance of the trip. The Concierge actually returned my call saying there is no guarantee, but that they would surely try to get us tickets once we arrived. That blew me away - I've left messages for Concierges before in other hotels/cities and never received a call back!!! My girlfriend and I arrived at the hotel by taxi and were greeted by Mike, the Bellman. We had lots of bags and were very tired so he was a site for sore eyes! And what a friendly guy! We checked in easily (if you prepay the room, you get a WONDERFUL price so look into that for a steal of a deal!) and received exactly as we requested - upper floor away from the elevator. The hotel has 11 floors and we were put on the 10th floor! The hotel is ATRIUM styled with fountain in the lobby so sound does carry up. It has an open-air feeling to it. Lots of greenery makes it really beautiful! The elevators are fast and there are 4!!!! (I've been in hotels of the same size that had only 2 very slow elevators so this was a real bonus to me!)The Embassy Rooms are so large and roomy compared to other hotels! The flat-screened TV in the living room totally impressed me. But there is also a large TV in the bedroom as well. The beds are VERY comfy! The room was immaculate and having a refrigerator and microwave in the room is nice and convenient.I went to the Concierge desk and talked to Richard, who is so very professional and kind. I asked about Oprah tickets and he explained what their process is. He left a note for the morning Concierge to call the show and request tickets on our behalf. There are no promises but they do make a great effort which is should be acknowledged. The FREE breakfast is amazing! Hot, made to order omelets, pancakes, hash browns, cold cereals, bagels/toast/muffins, fresh fruit, juice, coffee - it's all there. And the cold items are cold as they should be as well as the hot items are hot! The staff clears the tables quickly - leave a little tip on the table for them cause they are very helpful and efficient. When we returned to the hotel in the afternoon, Philip, another Concierge, had left a message saying they requested the tickets from Oprah and would let us know if they heard from them. Philip had gotten the note from Richard and actually FOLLOWED THROUGH! Another WOW!After returning from shopping, Richard was back at the Concierge desk so we stopped to find out if he had heard from Oprah staff yet and he said no. We took the elevator up and by time we got in our room Richard had called and said that the Oprah staff called as soon as we walked away from the desk! We were put on Standby for the next days early morning taping. We were elated! In one hour we were told that we were upgraded to CONFIRMED! Richard even re-confirmed the time we were supposed to be there - then called us back with specific instructions for when to arrive, when we needed to leave the hotel by, and other necessary guidelines we needed to follow.This was totally a dream come true for me - to be able to see a taping of the Oprah Show! We gave Richard a BIG tip for his help! And also tipped Philip for his help too!During the remaining part of our stay, Richard was also very helpful in guiding us for meals. And Philip gave us info about Late Nite Catechism, which was playing at the Royal George Theater. What a hilarious show this is! Catch it if you can - only $30 at the door. Front desk staff was also very cordial. This hotel rates as FIVE STAR service! It is so very convenient to Magnificent Mile. There is a great grocery store across the street and, of course, a Starbucks on the corner. We did not dine in the restaurant or take advantage of the evening reception but both looked very popular with other guests. Overall this hotel rated 5 stars out of 5 on my survey card!!! Primo indeed! I also find it awesome that the management team acknowledges the reviews on this website with their thanks. How spectacular!

Oct 21 2008 	Wouldn't recommend for Extended Stay	I stayed here for two weeks for business training. The hotel was in a convienent location near the Magnificent Mile and bus/train stops. The walls are paper thin in the rooms and you can hear those right outside your door if they are talking in a normal voices. I was almost able to hear full conversations through the vents from the guests near me. You can hear when the guests next door have the water running because the pipes are loud. The noise from the atrium will filter up to the rooms also. There is only one washer and two dryers for all guests that may wash there own laundry. It is inconvienent to be able to get change and laundry detergent at the front desk, but they are willing to give you change and let you buy single laundry detergent. I wouldn't recommend using the laundry service they have because the price is per item (ie. your underwear cost 6 dollars a piece to wash). I would recommend the dry cleaning at the hotel or the dry cleaners about four blocks south of the hotel on the right. The hotel did fix this within the next few days, but it temporarily maxed my card out for those few days waiting for them to refund it. All in all, an okay time with a few minor bumps. While this one did have nice waterfalls running through the hotel, it lacked the huge goldfish that typically fill these pools.The happy hour always had a line, sometimes a very long one. What made this even worse was there was a limit of one drink per person, so everyone you were with had to go up to bar rather than you getting a drink for both yourself and your companion. Seating around the bar quickly filled up and so you could not simply point to the person. Getting a drink meant saving your seat, or worse, if one of you was getting ready, waiting for the other to go down to get a drink.At breakfast there was the same issue. There was a line every morning, and finding seating was actually difficult on some mornings. They include a guide on when breakfast is the busiest in the room.On the last day we were there it took 10 minutes to get an elevator from the 2nd floor up to our room. Then, when we were leaving it took another 10 to get an elevator back down, and we subsequently stopped at every floor.However, almost all of these are the result of the hotel being in such a great location. And you get what you traditionally get with an Embassy Suites: giant rooms and very good service. Overall, if you want location and the quality of an Embassy Suites with just a few downsides, I would recommend this hotel.

Jun 20 2008 	Friendly Service Can't Be Beat!	My husband and I stayed there the first week in June while my husband attended a training class. We arrived very early on a Sunday morning, and our driver took us to the hotel to drop off our bags before we went for breakfast and to play tourists for the day. The staff was delightful--immediately checked our bags in the locked bell room, offered to get us a cab (no need---our driver, Al, offered to wait and take us directly to the restaurant!), and tried to see if any room would be open soon, just in case we were tired and wanted to check in (no luck, but HEY, it was only 8 am...). We went off for a lovely day checking out the Chicago sites. Once fatigue (and mild jet lag) set in, we called in hopes our room was ready and it was--at 1pm when check in was 3!After check in, both the floor housekeeping staff and a manager stopped by to see how we liked the room (it was fine), and dropped off some bottled water. After a brief rest, we headed down to check out the manager reception--we've been to Embassy Suites before a we're quite familiar with the amenities. Of course, we were off schedule and wondered why at 5:30, it wasn't open yet--it wasn't until we decided to wander around outdoors that it occurred to us that it was only 4:30 in Chicago.....oops.The nightly reception is a nice touch--in fact, I think one night we basically skipped dinner because we had enjoyed the hors d'ourves and quiet opporunity to relax in the atrium. The breakfast, the same---the staff was so friendly and welcoming. I liked that in your room, they give you an idea of the best times to go to breakfast if you're looking to avoid lines--not that I saw any line so long that it would have frightened me away --even with a huge convention crowd on-site (I worked in my hotel room for part of the day during my stay, and made a few trips down to refill my coffee since their brew was better than the coffee I could do in-room). The manager was great! Encouraged everyone to enjoy their meal. The made-to-order staff was also accomodating--not being an omelet lover, I asked for fried eggs, which they were happy to make. Lots of choices, always a good thing.While I wasn't there long enough to try the hotel's restaurant, I can tell you if it's anything like the room service food--it's a must-do! I had the most wonderful BLT sandwich from there. Of course, in Chicago, you have sooo many food choices. Even the grocer across the street had fun eats. We opted not to try the indoor pool, just not enough time. It looked average, maybe ready for an update. Not so inviting we couldn't resist--of course, traveling without our young kids, it has to be a pretty spectacular pool for us to suit up when we're on our own.The location was within easy walking distance of the training center my husband needed to go to and the Magnificent Mile (which I HAD to go to ;-0) Even with a computer bag (or several shopping bags, it was an easy walk. The musuems and Navy Pier were less walkable, but there is enough reasonable public transportation opportunities to get you there, no matter your budget. Price wise, the hotel was steeper than we'd normally pay for an Embassy Suite, but I realize this is high season, mid-town and there was a huge convention going on, so rooms were going for a premium. If it was our dime exclusively, we'd have to try for an off-season rate.This was our first visit to Chicago and I have to agree with other reviews--it's all that NYC has to offer, but with a smile! We'll be back.

Jun 7 2008 	Great value	Stayed here for a short business trip. A 2 room suite with 2 TV's, free breakfast and cocktails, comfortable bed and convenient location was under $240. And if needed, the room also had a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. A vanity sink was in both the bedroom and bathroom, and a bar type sink was in the galley. Only problem were the bathroom drains--- they seemed sluggish and probably needed a bit of maintenance. Otherwise, an AOK stay. Recommended!!
Jun 2 2008	pretty nice place	hotel is above average in service and quality not the best place I have stayed however on a 1-10 scale would be 8.5!

May 26 2008 	Great stay!	This hotel is great. the staff is very friendly. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are very spacious with a great view. Then another elevator from the main lobby to the sky lobby and then another elevator from the sky lobby to the guest rooms. At the busiest times of day, be prepared to wait for the elevators.

May 10 2008 	Great base for visiting Chicago	Large, clean, quiet, well designed rooms. Good breakfast and complimentary drinks at the bar early evening. A great base in the city for a first-time visitor.

May 5 2008	Great location for seeing Chicago	Spent three days at the North Columbus hotel. It is walking distance to Michigan Ave, Navy Pier, and Grant Park's north side. Huge hotel but had plenty of elevators and had no problem going up or down. Didn't try the pool or cocktail hour, but breakfast was edible, the made-to-order eggs looked the best but I don't like eggs. The location also great, seconds away from Michigan ave. Absolutly no view from room, right into parking garage and was a little loud at night, but that never bothers me. Overall will probably stay here again.

Apr 26 2008 	Our Favorit Hotel in Chicago	Our family prefers this hotel to any other (including staying with family members in the city). It is conveniently located to everything we want to do. We like the fact that we can use the indoor pool and love the hot breakfast with everything we would need to start the day of right.

Apr 26 2008 	This is our favorite hotel in Chicago	The staff at this hotel is extra friendly and makes our family feel at home every time we are there. Apr 17 2008 	Unfriendly staff overrated breakfast	Hospitality defined by apathetic and unfriendly staff is what you may experience at your stay here. We regretted the decision the day we walked in, where we were greeted rather unkindly by the front desk staff who could not crack a smile.Anytime we contacted the front desk, we had to call back numerous times, as they took forever to answer, although February was no big busy month for hotels in Chicago.The few times they actually got the phone, they were by no means courteous and hospitable. I don't think that guests should be made uncomfortable for asking for basic services or simple questions at a hotel. Mar 27 2008 	Good Spring Break Choice	Nice hotel, convenient to many places. Had two problems. First, pool was closed all day Monday after we arrived. Mar 6 2008 	Love the hotel but hate the over priced parking! Big time gouge!	The hotel is a superb facility located in the middle of anything you could want to do, even walking in sub zero temps! Feb 26 2008	Great location great breakfast	Hotel was centrally located just north of the Chicago River, perfect for the Mag Mile and Hancock Tower and just a few blocks from the Loop. Feb 23 2008 	Great Stay	I stayed here for 2 nights on business. The hot breakfast every morning was great. The manager reception at night offers 2 hours of free drinks and hot dogs. Feb 19 2008 	Good Stay Good Location	This hotel is located on State St.It is nearby to a number of fine restaurants and attractions.All of the major attractions are either within a taxi ride or walk.The hotel is nice, the main lobby is not as extensive as you would expect for a regular Embassy Suites but the restaurant area and pool & fitness center are very nice.Our room was on the 11th floor and we had a view of the downtown area. Jan 19 2008 	Great Stay	Booked on hilton.com and got a good rate. Check in was very fast, asked for a room on a high floor away from the elevator and that is just what I got. Jan 1 2008 	Great location but nothing special	We had a group of 8 in 4 rooms for 3 nights. Dec 12 2007	Loved it!!	We really enjoyed our weekend trip to Chicago. The hotel was was really nice. Check in was fast and we even got to check in four hours early. Dec 7 2007 	good location	We stayed here for two nights in october on floor 17.If you have young children or suffer from vertigo stay lower down!The hallways overlook an atrium but the walls are glass..made me feel peculiar!The suites are well fitted out but i would say suitable for 4 max.Free breakfast good quality no waiting and have a much as you like.Happy hour in evening a little souless but hey its free.Location is great and in an area where we all felt completely safe.Well stocked supermarket just across the street.

Oct 30 2007 	Fantastic time!	This hotel was recommended to us. Oct 16 2007 	Met Our Needs	My family (husband, 14 yo & 12 yo) stayed here for 3 nights. Definitely in the heart of the city. Fairly quiet for being downtown. Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Free happy hour from 5:30-7:30 nightly. Very hearty breakfast. Clean room. Would stay here again.

Sep 9 2007 	Great Location Great Hotel	After winning this hotel on Priceline I immediately went to TripAdvisor to check out the reviews. I was worried - the recent reviews are awful. Aug 20 2007 	Even better Than Expected	I'd heard glowing reviews of Embassy Suites but the photos on the Web site looked just average. Aug 5 2007 	Don't Expect Too Much	Maybe I've come to expect too much, but I have to say I was pretty disappointed with our four night stay at the Embassy. May 4 2007 	Enjoyed our trip	It's all you would expect from an Embassy Suites Hotel. Location was great as well as the breakfast and happy hour. My only complaints were that the fitness room was very warm and there was not a safe in the room. We loved it though!

Apr 27 2007 	Great Location!	My spouse and I spent two nights and had a pleasurable stay. Hotel is close to Michigan Ave and 1 block to the L red line. We arrived at the hotel early on our check in day and the staff allowed us to check in. Staff was pleasent and helpful. Room was very clean. We would certainly stay here again.

Apr 25 2007 	Solid hotel great location	We stayed here for five nights with our two daughters. The hotel staff was always helpful and attentive. The parking valets where especially nice. It's an easy walk to Michigan Avenue. We drove to the museums. Only complaint: There was a wedding one night and the young adults from the wedding partied loudly way into the night. They woke our daughters a couple times. The hotel staff was slow to respond.

Apr 23 2007 	Fun Trip - Decent Hotel	Mom, sis and I met in Chicago for a girl's weekend to celebrate my mother's birthday. We arrived at the hotel at 8:45 AM on Friday morning. I was able to preregister at the desk and the employee told me I could check back earlier than 3 since my room would probably be ready. The extremely friendly bellman took my luggage and teased me that "it was so sad we had to go shopping!" Security was also very helpful and locked my laptop in their security area rather than the general luggage hold.We came back at 2 and the room was ready. 10th floor, corner room, 2 doubles. Complimentary bottled water was waiting for us as a HH member. The room was very clean and extremely quiet. Beds/pillows were extremely comfortable. The pullout bed was a no-go as it was just too flimsy. Sis and mom ended up sharing a bed :) I lucked out on that one!!The breakfast bar each day was not crowded, but we were there around 8 am each day. Choices were the normal breads, meats, eggs. The hot foods were slightly cold and the bread a little stale the first day. The next day we got cooked to order eggs which were MUCH better. Overall not bad especially since included in the room rate. We were always gone during the manager's reception so no review on it.The hotel offers free internet in the business center which I used two days to check email and get boarding passes. The room did not have an ethernet cable (I forgot mine) so my laptop was of no use. The location is awesome with just a few blocks from Michigan Ave. We had restaurants all around and walked everywhere. We walked to the Oriental Theater Saturday night and did not feel unbearingly unsafe on the walk back - we speed walked back and made it in about 12 minutes :)Overall, nice clean hotel, great staff and comfy beds. Great location!!

Apr 12 2007 	Excellent location on budget	We have a family of 4 so to get a room that would accommodate 6 was superb value for money. The breakfast in the morning is more than adequate and the managers free drinks in the evening was a bonus.The staff were very friendly and helpful, I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city on a budget.

Apr 8 2007 	great location mediocre hotel	Booked too far in advance and was stuck with a pricey, inflexible reservation. Lovely view of a parking ramp. Note that the luggage carts can only be used by bellmen. There's a lot of nickel and diming at the facility, which isn't very family-friendly. Breakfast buffet is largely inedible.

Mar 31 2007	Good location decent suite.	I spent three nights here on business for a conference at the McCormick Convention Center. The location is excellent with respect to tourist locations in Chicago, but poor for getting to the convention center. The hotel staff was nice and gladly let me switch rooms the first evening due to problems with a neighbor. The hotel was a little noisy with tourist traffic (i.e. kids running around), but evenings were quiet. The rooms were large suites, which was a little overkill. The kitchenette area was in need of some renovation. In both rooms, the cabinetry was warping and there were stains on the floor near the minifridge. Everything else was average. Breakfast was included, and consisted for the standard bagels and muffins, in addition to hot items like an omelet bar, bacon, sausage, eggs, hasbrowns, etc. While the room wasn't as nice as I had anticipated, the overall experience was satisfactory and I would consider staying here again if other options were booked.

Mar 31 2007 	Very Comfortable - Very Affordable - Good Quality	This hotel is centrally located to many of Chicago's inner-city major businesses and restaurants. It is very close to the underground metro and taxi service is easy to and from all locations. The rooms are quite comfortable but I needed maintenance to turn the air handler to "Summer" as all I could get was warm air and it was 80-degrees in the room. The manager's reception is quite nice and you can make a meal of the snacks that are served. I secured this reservation directly with Hilton Hotels and actually received a better rate ($149) than Expedia. One final note - Homewood Suites downtown is a far superior lodging accommodation and is also part of the Hilton Hotel chain.

Mar 28 2007	Hotel and Staff Are Fantastic!	Spent this past weekend with my husband @ the Embassy Suites Downtown and had a fantastic time. We were very impressed with the hotel and all of the "extras" (fabulous breakfast, Manager's evening reception). We were equally impressed by how friendly and helpful the staff of the hotel were. We will definately stay there again on our next visit to Chicago.

Mar 16 2007 	Nice Hotel in the middle of Downtown	I stayed here for a convention that I attended. What a great place. They have a free cooked to order breakfast daily and in the evening they have a Managers Complimentary snacks and cocktails from 5-7 nightly. Lobby area is actully a floor above from the ground level which makes it a nice place to sit and relax. This is also where the breakfast area is. The rooms are mini suites and are very comfortable. The hotel is close to all of downtown and within walking distance from the Navy Pier. The city of Chicago is a great town. Other members that attended the convention were staying at the Sheraton and the Ritz across the street from us and were disappointed. They had to pay for everything including the newspaper. Our was delivered free daily to your room. There were a lot of families there also so I would recommned this hotel for families. Overall great place and very convienent. I would stay there again for business or pleasure.

Mar 2 2007	Excellent Service...Close to everything	I have not stayed at this particular property in about 5 years, moved to the Lakefront Embassy for awhile. Breakfasts are the BEST...cooked to order or yogurt or doughnuts...etc. This hotel is close to all shopping, theatres and nightlife. I enjoyed the valet parking free "deal" offered by Hilton. It was nice to pull into the heated car lot, have someone park my car and take the elevator up to checkin. Loved the doorman, very kind and friendly and the evening hospitality included hot dogs, free drink and munchies. My 16 year old daughter and I took in the show "Wicked" and it was a great walk there and back. We love Chicago and all it has to offer and we love Hilton Hotels in Chicago!

Feb 16 2007 	great location	Great location! Girlfriend w/e....adjoining suites. Nice size living room area in suite,clean, good showers, lot of towels,empty refrig, microwave, hair dryer, drapes make rooms really dark. Entire staff was extremely friendly & helplful. Would HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Jan 23 2007 	Loved it!!!	The hotel was beautiful! Location was awesome. Large, spacious rooms. Large bathroom, clean too! Everyone was so helpful. Down the street from hard rock, rock bottom, rock & roll mcdonalds. 5 min ride to navy pier. 5 min walk to michigan ave. Perfect perfect perfect!! Would definately stay again.

Jan 17 2007 	Very happy with the Embassy Suites	Just returned from a 5 night stay at the hotel with my husband. The location is perfect. You are two blocks from Michigan Avenue, and one block from the Grand Subway station. There is also a Starbucks right beside the hotel and small grocery store right across the street. The breakfast at the hotel is the normal stuff at breakfast buffets, omlettes were nice. The nightly reception was also great. It was very crowded over the weekend, but we never waited more than a few minutes in line for breakfast or for a drink a night. The room service was so-so, over priced, had it one night for dinner. The room looked like it had been redone recently. Linens were nice. There was a little bit of street noise at night, but we were so exhausted every night from walking around that I hardly noticed it. The workout room was great, had 3 treadmills, 2 elipticals, and 2 bikes, plus free weights. We did most of the tourisist stuff and really enjoyed ourselves in Chicago. I highly recommend going to see Wicked at the Oriental theater. Outstanding performance and enjoyed the venue. Also check out restaurant.com before you go, as there is many restaurants in the downtown area. We had an amazing dinner at the Chestnut Grill on Chestnut Street near the Hancock building. I bought a gift certificate on restaurant.com for $10 which we used.

Jan 4 2007 	Freezing cold pool!	My husband, 4 year-old daughter and I stayed at this property December 30 - Januray 2nd. Overall, the hotel was clean, staff were friendly and the location was great. Unfortunately, we had a few problems.Our room, upon arrival, was very cold and the cable was broken. A custodian came to fix both problems and was successful after several hours of work. My biggest complaint was the pool. The tile appeared dirty and the temperature of the water was very cold. We complained the first day and the staff admitted the heater had been turned down (why?) and that they would increase the temp by the following day. The next day, although it was a bit warmer, it was still too cold for us to swim. Since the pool is my daughter's favorite thing at any hotel, the cold temp really dimished our enjoyment. We will not return to this hotel.

Dec 27 2006 	2 Stays - Both Awesome!	Family and I stayed two nights at the beginning of the week and one night at the end of the week. I'm sure there are other great places to stay in Chicago, but it would be hard for any of them to beat the Embassy Suites Downtown. The staff - from the doorman to the bellhops to the front desk to the breakfast and evening hospitality crews - are all first class. Any request was met with a smile and "sure we can" attitude. None of the nights were sold out, so evening and breakfast crowds were not too bad. On the Friday night stay, there were definitely more families with more children. This was most noticeable in the pool and business center (the hotel should ban under 18 from the business center). We got an incredible Internet rate through the Hilton web site, but this place would have been worth a higher price. The place is modern and everything was in great working order. The breakfast line is very efficient as the get the omelettes started and add the ingredients as requested - it helps keep the line moving. Was always able to find plenty to eat and places to sit.There is a grocery store right across the street and plenty of restaurants within easy (and very safe) walking distance. The grocery even has a good deli counter with hot food. If going to Navy Pier, the free trolley is fine, but not as frequent as the bus (a bargain at $2 per adult and older child). Someone told me their family took a cab - $10, including tip. The Chicago Childrens Museum is really loads of fun - check your local museum for reciprocal membership privelages.I will definitely try to stay here on any return trip, especially at a great rate.

Dec 27 2006 	nice but i overpaid	Booked in mid nov at the embassy web site and got an internet rate of $249. Thought it was a deal, until I checked again a week before i left and see I could have saved about $75 a night. Do not ever book any internet rate. Booked $249 for a king, asked if they could accomdate a double when I got there, they said no, since I had a pre-paid room. Almost $1000.00. Sad thing was the hotel was only half booked and I could have had a double if they really wanted to give me one, and I am a Hilton Member too. Breakfast was good, evening reception was good, loved Chicago, but next time will stay in a cheaper hotel.

Nov 29 2006 	Great stay during Thanksgiving	My family stayed here over the Thanksgiving holiday. Although the hotel was very busy, the staff dealt with everything wonderfully. This could get old if you are staying for a long time. This hotel has an exceptional location - it is very convenient for shopping on Michigan Avenue and there are many excellent restaurants within easy walking distance. There is internet available, but it is not free.

Nov 26 2006 	great experience at embassy suites	we stayed at the embassy suites over the thanksgiving holiday. check in was very easy and fast. our room was very nice and clean. after we arrived in our room, a maid came by and brought us ice and terry robes to use during our stay. the evening reception was very nice also. the bartenders were very friendly, even though we had to wait in line for our drinks. (the hotel was booked full) . breakfast omlets were very good also, my only complaint would be that the buffet food could have been hotter. But overall we were very satified with our stay, and would stay there again.

Nov 6 2006 	Awesome Location	The Embassy Suites Downtown is located in the middle of everything. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. We loved the complementary breakfast and the free drinks they serve from 5-7. There's a Starbuck's and ColdStone Creamery in the same building, which we loved. It's almost impossible to find hotels this spacious at this price!

Oct 9 2006 	Great location great value	Stayed at the Embassy Suites Downtown for 5 nights to attend a business conference. The location is fantastic, with no need to rent a car if you can make it to the hotel without one (take the airport shuttle or taxi). Everything is in walking distance, great restaurants close by, and in a safe area. The front desk managed to find a free King suite upon my request at check in, since I had been reserved a double by mistake. Rooms kept clean, the bed was very comfortable, absolutely no problems with the room. The extra value is in the daily breakfast and manager's reception. Even if the line seems long at breakfast, it moves quickly, and there are always tables available by the time you need one. The nightly happy hour is a nice change from the 12 dollar drinks you will pay at area restaurants, so take advantage of it if you're so inclined. Not premium brands, but hey, it's free. It was also very nice to be greeted upon returning from to the hotel each evening with a friendly, "Welcome Home!" by the porter. They seem to make an effort to be friendly and warm. I would use this hotel again.

Oct 3 2006 	Liked staying in this area	Found this property to be a decent value and a great neighborhood. I have an emotional attachment to the Palmer House, but this was cheaper, and, of course, there is free breakfast, free drinks and plenty of space. Everything was pretty well managed and maintained. I really liked staying in this part of town...it feels a little scary in parts of the loop after dark, but it felt safer walking around in this area. The selection of restaurants was better, too.

Aug 28 2006	Nice hotel right in the middle of the downtown action.	We stayed at the Embassy Suites Downtown for one night. It is a nice place, and one of the cheapest I could find right in the middle of downtown. The only thing that we didn't like was the parking situation. It was a hassle to get into the garage w/ traffic, but the valets were nice when we finally made it in. The only issue was when we were ready to leave we had to wait a while for them to get the car from an outside lot  so your car doesnt always stay in the garage. The room was very nice and clean. Most of the staff was friendly (with the exception of the front desk person). We didnt take advantage of the Managers Reception, but had the complementary breakfast the next morning which include an omelet bar. Yum! I recommend this hotel if you want a nice room at a cheaper rate than most that are downtown, right in the middle of the action!

Aug 26 2006 	Downtown Chicago Embassy was Sweet	This is the best place that I have stayed at in Chicago! The location was excellent, just a couple of blocks away from Michigan Avenue and some great restaurants. The staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. Do not hesitate to ask them any questions. I especially enjoyed the manager's reception, which featured free drinks and snacks from 5:30 to 7:30 every evening. (The snacks were soft pretzels, tacos, and hush puppies on the nights that I stayed, but chips and pretzels were also served each night.) Some people complained about the selection, or the speed in which they were able to get their free drinks...but it's FREE DRINKS IN CHICAGO (not something to complain about in my book). I was able to get the drinks that I wanted, and as many as I wanted, within the 2 hours. The bartenders were also very friendly.The breakfast was decent enough. French toast, bacon, sausage, and eggs were plentiful as the hot breakfast each day. Bagels, toast, cereal, milk, great orange juice, and passable coffee rounded up the daily breakfast offerings. I'd recommend having a peaceful early breakfast (around 7am) instead of joining in the chaotic rush around 9am.I will definitely be staying here during my next trip to Chicago. Here's a tip: The parking is about 10 bucks cheaper per night at the lot around the corner from the hotel on Ohio (just a quick left before State Street) than at the actual hotel lot located on State Street.

Aug 14 2006	couldn't of asked for better hotel!	Went to spend 5 days with friends, and children. What a great place! The staff was helpful, the free breakfast and managers reception was excellent, couldn't of asked for a better value. Only drawback was the swimming pool was only 4' deep, but didn't bother our 9 years old. They had a great time anyway. The rooms were clean and well maintained.

Jul 14 2006	Great Place	Got a really nice rate from Priceline and spent the weekend at this place. The breakfast is second to none, and I really liked how the lobby was set up. PERFECT LOCATION. Its is walking distance from everywhere. Other people have written reviews that criticize the noise, but on the 13th floor I didn't notice any. Its withing walking distance of the mile and many other attractions. If you want to hit the Sears Tower, I also recommend walking (kind of a hike but there is a lot to see). Great hotel, and I have been to many.

Jul 7 2006	Had a nice time	We stayed here on July 3, 2006 with our 2 kids. The location is close to everything. We were able to walk to Rock N Roll McDonalds, Rainforest, Hardrock, and Ed Devebicks (sp?). We also caught the sightseeing bus by the Mcdonalds. We walked and shopped on Michigan Avenue. There was plenty of seating for both. We loved having the extra space in the room. We parked in the parking garage and didn't have any problems.The lobby area was really pretty with a cascading waterfall.The only complaint we have is the kids said the pool was too small.

Jun 29 2006	Excellent Family Hotel	My family stayed here for five nights and had a great experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The concierge was very helpful and gave good advice. The place was very family friendly. The breakfast and evening reception, while not fancy, were quite wecome and make the hotel a good value for a family.The location was great - restaurants and a grocer nearby. Michigan Ave. was just a couple of blocks away. The train was just a block up the street.Sun - Wed were great, with no lines at all. Starting Thursday it got a little crowded and the pool got a bit rowdy. Otherwise, we had no complaints.All in all, a great place for a few days in the city with the kids.

May 10 2006	Great Honeymoon	We were on our honeymoon and from the first moment we arrived, we were treated very well. Our suite was on the top floor and was clean, comfortable, and nicely appointed. May 9 2006	Two nights at the Embassay Suites	Nice hotel, excellent location. I had requested a late check in, which may have explained the back corner room facing parking garage. Managers reception nice, cocktails good, staff friendly, hor doerves minimal and frozen. But still a nice place to grab a drink before dinner. Front end staff accomodating, door man pleasant. Apr 19 2006	Highly Recommended	I stayed here with a group of 7 women and everyone of us would recommend it. The location is fantastic with shops, bars and restaurants right on your doorstep. The rooms were cleaned every day, and towels replaced which was great. Breakfast was included and offered a good selection. If I were to fault the hotel it would be on the leisure facilities. The pool is quite small and on the one occasion I got into the jacuzzi with my friend there was children jumping in and out of it constantly which really annoyed us.However it didn't stop us enjoying ourselves, and would definitely stay here again if I returned to Chicago.

Feb 26 2006	Great stay	We have stayed at this hotel many times. This was the best stay by far. The service was excellent... Friendly staff. Great happy hour and breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel. Also had a great meal across the street at Weber Grill.

Jan 22 2006	Embassy Suites on State - Great	We especially appreciated the helpfulness of Titus, a Food Service Manager, and Richard, the concierge. We would definitely come back to stay at this hotel, with its great staff, location and services.

Dec 12 2005	Good family hotel	My teenage daughter and I stayed here in July 2005. Hotel is a block from a subway station (we rode a train from Midway) and is close to a bus route that goes to Navy Pier (good for nighttime). We were able to walk everywhere. We only ate breakfast once as it was crowded but there was a separate seating area for young children with small furniture, cartoons on a big screen and kid-friendly cereal. Mostly kids using it.

Sep 10 2005 	Good Location Okay Hotel	This hotel has a good location and the rooms are nice; service was fine. There were far too many kids running around on the weekend -- and I do mean running. Jul 11 2005	We stay at this hotel ever year	Every July we travel to Chicago for shopping and all the attractions. This hotel was our first in Chicago.
